question_content.barrons:question: Based on the information in the two graphs, by what percent did the number of students in the Central City School district increase from 1985 to 1990?
question_content.barrons:explanation:
25

As in the solution to Question 15, the number of students in any year can be calculated from the equation:

(number of students) × (expenditure per student) = total expenditure

1985: (number of students) × ($8,000) = $16,000,000. So, the number of students was 2,000

1990: (number of students) × ($10,000) = $25,000,00. So, the number of students was 2,500

Finally, the number of students in the school increased from 2,000 to 2,500, an increase of 500 and a percent increase of
